title: Fans denied big World Cup final event due to lack of big screens at sporting landmarks
text:
Fans hoping to gather en masse for England's biggest rugby union match in 12 years face disappointment due to a lack of big screens available at sporting landmarks.

Both Trafalgar Square - the scene of wild celebrations after the nation's cricketing World Cup triumph this summer - and Twickenham have already ruled out showing the nation's World Cup final against South Africa.

However, should England be crowned champions on Saturday for only the second time in history, Trafalgar Square will be offered to the RFU for a homecoming celebration, the Daily Telegraph understands.
